content: LIMITATION OF COST-OF-LIVING ADJUSTMENTS for pay for Members of Congress and certain senior Federal officials. Members of Congress' pay adjustments are tied to the General Schedule rates under the Legislative Reorganization Act of 1946. Adjustments are made based on the first applicable pay period after an adjustment in the General Schedule rates, rounded to the nearest multiple of $100. The pay adjustments for Members of Congress are linked to the General Schedule rates, with adjustments made based on the most recent percentage change in the ECI, rounded to the nearest multiple of $100. The pay adjustments for Members of Congress are determined by the most recent percentage change in the ECI or the maximum percentage increase under the Social Security Act for the applicable year. The adjustment is based on the first day of the fiscal year. The amendment to the Civil Service Retirement System limits the adjustment for annuities based on service as a Member or in an Executive Schedule position to the lesser of the percentage adjustment under the current section or the maximum percentage increase under the Social Security Act.
